Hi Jim,

It took me a while to figure out what was going on here.  I think =
what
is happening is that assert equals uses "..." for equal parts of the
e=
xpected and actual values.  So in your example, "<... ...> but was
<......>=
" means that there was not a space where it expected one to be.


assertEqu=
als("foobar", "abc", "abc123") would print:
Foobar expected: <...> but was =
<...123>

If you don't like this behavior you can always implement your own=

version of assertEquals.

Hope this helps,
Kris

ors.

 "foobar");

.>"

rse, but

> fea=
ture turned

rrounding
> context (say, at least ten characters on each side).  Any plans=
 to fix
> it?
